title: DRP Analysis
text: part fit dose-response model DRP data stored local Postgres database compute drug response metrics. Finally, visualize dose-response fingerprints drug distributions. Make connection local Postgres database
code: # Define the project root here::i_am("inst/analysis.Rmd") con <- drpr::connect_with_config("default")

title: DRP Analysis
text: Fit dose responses 3-parameter log-logistic model using drc package. Write cohort statistics (mean, standard deviation, median, IQR) primary DRP cohort database. fitted dose response parameter compute derivative metrics absolute logEC50 logAUC. Use cohort statistics compute z-scores logAUC metric.
code: pool::dbReadTable(con, "plate_content_view") |>   drpr::cli_fit(con) cohort_stats <- readr::read_csv(here::here("inst/data/cohort_stats.csv")) pool::dbWriteTable(con, "cohort_stats", cohort_stats, append = TRUE) pool::dbReadTable(con, "feature_view") |>   drpr::derive_fit_features(con) |>   drpr::calculate_zscore_from_stats(con, cohort_id = 1, logAUC) |>   dplyr::select(drug_name, logEC50, norm_logAUC, abs_logEC50, zlogAUC) |>   dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(is.numeric, ~ round(.x, 2))) |>   drpr::as_flextable(     save = TRUE,     filename = here::here("man/figures/plots/feature_table.png")   )

title: DRP Analysis
text: Visualize dose-response profiles drug distributions
code: drpr::plot_profile(   con,   drug_name %in% c("Venetoclax", "Bortezomib", "Dexamethasone", "Dasatinib"),   .fg_sample_mask = sid == 1,   color_fill = zlogAUC,   limits = c(-1.5, 1.5),   quantiles = TRUE,   save = TRUE,   filename = here::here("man/figures/plots/profiles.png"),   nrow = 1,   width = 10 ) drpr::plot_distribution(   con,   .point_mask = sid == 1,   .jitter_mask = cohort_id == 1,   color_fill = zlogAUC,   sort_by = norm_logAUC,   quantiles = TRUE,   add_boxplot = TRUE,   limits = c(-1.5, 1.5),   save = TRUE,   filename = here::here("man/figures/plots/distribution.png") )

title: Loading data via REST-API
text: load DRP data Postgres database via standardized REST interface. thsis purpose start local REST-API server background (server can shut later app$kill())

title: Loading data via REST-API
text: Instantiate new test patient, disease stage, sample assay making HTTP POST request database
code: crf <- list(   patient = list(     pid = 1,     patient_crossref = "ZH-01",     birth_year = 2020,     diagnosis_id = 2,     sex_id = 1,     diagnosis_id = 2,     treating_hospital_id = 1   ),   stage = list(     stage_id = 1,     pid = 1,     disease_stage_id = 0,     stage_date = "2025-01-01",     tissue_id = 2   ),   sample = list(     sid = 1,     stage_id = 1,     pid = 1,     sample_crossref = "ZH-01-A",     puncture_date = "2025-01-01",     timepoint_collection = "d0",     tissue_id = 1   ),   assay = list(     assay_id = 1,     assay_description = "test_assay",     sid = 1,     drp_date = "2025-01-05",     leukemia_seeded = 10000,     fresh = FALSE,     msc_detached_id = 0,     contamination = 0   ) )  # push the data into the database drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/patient",   method = "post",   body = crf[["patient"]] )  drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/stage",   method = "post",   body = crf[["stage"]] )  drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/sample",   method = "post",   body = crf[["sample"]] )  drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/assay",   method = "post",   body = crf[["assay"]] )  # check that the patient was indeed created drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/patient/1",   method = "get" )

title: Loading data via REST-API
text: Next, load drug layout database  Load measurement database  Assign layout, measurement assay plate Normalize drug responses DMSO
code: layout_body <- list(   layout_id = 1,   file = here::here(     "inst/data/layout.csv"   ),   type_id = 2,   format_id = 2 )  drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/layout",   method = "post",   body = layout_body ) measurement_body <- list(   measurement_id = 1,   file = here::here(     "inst/data/measurement.csv"   ),   plate_no = 1,   format_id = 2,   img_well_coverage = 0.66 )  drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/measurement",   method = "post",   body = measurement_body ) body <- tibble::tibble(   plate_id = 1,   layout_id = 1,   measurement_id = 1,   assay_id = 1 )  drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/plate",   method = "post",   body = body ) drpr::request(   uri = "{base_uri}/normalize_measurement/1",   method = "put" )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Fabio Steffen. Author, maintainer. Noemia Bruderer. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Steffen F, Bruderer N (2025). drpr: Drug response profiling. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/leukemia-kispi/Steffen-DRP-2025.
code: @Manual{,   title = {drpr: Drug response profiling},   author = {Fabio Steffen and Noemia Bruderer},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/leukemia-kispi/Steffen-DRP-2025}, }

title: Drug response profiling
text: repository accompanies manuscript: Steffen et al.¬†Drug response profiling guides precision therapy relapsed refractory childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia (2025)

title: Drug response profiling
text: repository provides step--step guide drug response analysis: üìÇ Loading perturbation measurements drug layouts relational database üìâ Fitting log-logistic dose response models üéØ Computing drug response metrics (logAUC, logEC50, Vres) üëç Scoring individual drug fingerprints relative reference cohort üìä Visualizing drug profiles distributions

title: Drug response profiling
text: Install Postgres setup local DRP database following shell commands Note: like look data outside R may also want get database management tool like DBeaver Install drpr package R session, e.g.¬†using pak
code: createdb steffen-drp-2025 psql -d steffen-drp-2025 -U postgres -f inst/ddl.sql psql -d steffen-drp-2025 -U postgres -f inst/import_reference.sql psql -d steffen-drp-2025 -U postgres -f inst/import_genes.sql  psql -d steffen-drp-2025 -U postgres -f inst/import_drugs.sql pak::local_install(".")

title: Drug response profiling
text: DRP analytical workflow divided two sections: Part 1: Loading data Postgres database Part 2: Fitting scoring drugs sensitivity resistance

title: Calculate average drug response ‚Äî average_response
text: Calculate average (mean median) response across grouping variables (e.g. Idarubicin responses present multiple plates) . default computes mean response patient, sample, assays drug across plates.

title: Calculate average drug response ‚Äî average_response
text: tbl tibble least columns pid sid drug_name assay_failed metrics selected ... ... Tidyselect columns (metrics) average Variables use grouping FUN Function use calculate_zscore_from_stats averaging exclude_failed Boolean indicating whether exclude assays failed QC (TRUE assay_failed=FALSE/NA)

title: Calculate average drug response ‚Äî average_response
text: tibble individual drug responses replaced averaged drug response

title: Calculate absolute logEC50 ‚Äî calculate_absolute_logEC
text: calculate_absolute_logEC computes absolute effect concentration (e.g. absolute logEC50 logEC20) LL.2, LL.3 LL.4 model. absolute logEC50 concentration four-parameter log-logistic function crosses 50% effect treshold. Note: logEC20 -> 20% effect = 20% inhibition = 80% viability

title: Calculate absolute logEC50 ‚Äî calculate_absolute_logEC
text: effect Percent absolute effect (e.g. 50 20) b Slope parameter c Lower asymptote d Upper asymptote logEC50 Logarithmic half-maximum effective concentration (relative EC50)

title: Calculate absolute logEC50 ‚Äî calculate_absolute_logEC
text: Concentration given response observed

title: Calculate absolute logEC50 ‚Äî calculate_absolute_logEC
text: equivalent drc::ED(mdl, effect/100, type="absolute") mdl drc::drm() object

text: type DSS type logAUC Logarithmic area---curve t Minimum activity treshold c_min Logarithmic lowest tested concentration c_max Logarithmic highest tested concentration x1 Logarithmic lower integration limit x2 Logarithmic lower integration limit d Upper asymptote

title: Calculate the normalized logEC50 ‚Äî calculate_norm_logEC50
text: calculate_norm_logEC50() computes normalized (feature scaled) logEC50. minimal logEC50 defined x1 - log_extra maximal logEC50 x2 + log_extra, x1 x2 lowest highest tested logarithmic concentration.

title: Calculate the normalized logEC50 ‚Äî calculate_norm_logEC50
text: logEC50 Logarithmic area---curve x1 Numeric indicating minimal tested logarithmic concentration x2 Numeric indicating maximal tested logarithmic concentration log_extra Integer indicating extra log orders around measured concentration range beyond logEC50 clipped

title: Calculate the normalized logEC50 ‚Äî calculate_norm_logEC50
text: Normalized EC50 logarithmic dose response curve

title: Calculate proliferation index ‚Äî calculate_proliferation
text: proliferation capacity assessed comparing number cancer cells 96h 18h (right drug addition). value 1 means cells proliferated average value 1 means loss cells viability due drug-independent cell death.

title: Calculate proliferation index ‚Äî calculate_proliferation
text: tbl tibble least following columns: sid assay_id readout_id (optional) con DBIConnection-class object DRP database readout_id Vector integers specifying readout IDs proliferation index calculated

title: Calculate proliferation index ‚Äî calculate_proliferation
text: Numeric specifying proliferation ratio assays/samples

title: Calculate proliferation index ‚Äî calculate_proliferation
text: response must readout_id 18h endpoint.

what: Calculate rank of fit parameters ‚Äî calculate_rank
title: Calculate rank of fit parameters ‚Äî calculate_rank
text: Calculate dplyr::min_rank() dplyr::percent_rank() fitting parameters (logIC50, logAUC, etc.) excluding assays failed QC. min_rank() gives every tie (smallest) value c(10, 20, 20, 30) gets ranks c(1, 2, 2, 4). way ranks usually computed sports percent_rank(x) counts total number values less x_i divides number observations minus 1. E.g. drug percent_rank = 0.9 absolute EC50 means 90% samples lower absolute EC50 present sample. cume_dist(x) counts total number values less equal x_i, divides number observations. E.g. drug cume_dist = 0.9 absolute EC50 means 90% samples lower equal absolute EC50 present sample. (missing values ignored observation count)

title: Calculate rank of fit parameters ‚Äî calculate_rank
Calculate rank of fit parameters ‚Äî calculate_rank
text: tbl tibble least following columns: drug_id metrics selected ... ... <tidy-select> Columns names fitting parameters calculate rank <tidy-select> Column group (e.g. drug_id) suffix Character string add rank column suffix

title: Calculate rank of fit parameters ‚Äî calculate_rank
text: tibble including rank columns

title: Calculate relative logEC ‚Äî calculate_relative_logEC
text: calculate_relative_logEC computes relative effect concentration (e.g. relative logEC50 logEC20) LL.2, LL.3 LL.4 model. relative logEC50 concentration effect half-maximal relative maximal effect (Emax). Emax relates residual cell population affected drug. Note: logEC20 -> 20% relative effect = 20% relative inhibition = 80% relative viability

title: Calculate relative logEC ‚Äî calculate_relative_logEC
text: effect Percent relative effect (e.g. 50 20) b Slope parameter c Lower asymptote d Upper asymptote logEC50 Logarithmic half-maximum effective concentration (relative EC50)

title: Calculate relative logEC ‚Äî calculate_relative_logEC
text: Concentration given response observed

title: Calculate relative logEC ‚Äî calculate_relative_logEC
text: equivalent drc::ED(mdl, effect/100, type="relative") mdl drc::drm() object

title: Clear R.cache ‚Äî clearCache
text: Clear temporary files R.cache::getCachePath() generated R.cache.

title: CLI for curve fitting ‚Äî cli_fit
text: command line interface (CLI) fitting dose response curves. CLI internally calls fit_wrapper fit, extract parameters predict dose response curves using drm package. parameters fitted curves written DRP Postgres database.

title: CLI for curve fitting ‚Äî cli_fit
code: cli_fit(   tbl,   con,   fixed = c(NA, NA, 1, NA, 1),   lowerl = c(0.01, 0, 1e-04),   upperl = c(2.5, 1, 1e+06),   start = NULL,   show_coefficients = FALSE )

title: CLI for curve fitting ‚Äî cli_fit
text: tbl tibble least columns: plate_id sid drug_id concentration readout_id norm_response con DBIConnection-class object DRP database fixed numeric vector specifying values parameters (b, c, d, e, f) fixed drc model. Variable parameters specified NA. lowerl Lower boundaries variable parameters upperl Upper boundaries variable parameters start Starting values variable parameters (NULL model chooses starting values automatically) show_coefficients Boolean indicating whether print fit coefficients

Variable parameters specified NA. lowerl Lower boundaries variable parameters upperl Upper boundaries variable parameters start Starting values variable parameters (NULL model chooses starting values automatically) readout_id Integer specifying readout (e.g. 1 = Viable leukemia cells) sid Integer specifying sample ID

title: Plot drug distribution ‚Äî plot_distribution
text: Distribution dot plot best drugs function ex vivo scoring metric (logEC50, logAUC, DSS). dots can colored second independent metric (e.g. top 10% outliers, diagnosis, disease stage etc.). distribution plot can combined geoms, see examples.

title: Plot drug distribution ‚Äî plot_distribution
code: plot_distribution(   con,   .jitter_mask = TRUE,   .point_mask = FALSE,   .drug_mask = TRUE,   x = drug_name,   metric = norm_logAUC,   color_fill = abs_logEC50,   readout_id = c(1, 5),   bg_readout_id = c(1, 5),   sort_by = NULL,   label = lknumber,   selected_labels = NULL,   palette = NULL,   color_fill_name = NULL,   add_boxplot = FALSE,   add_line = FALSE,   quantiles = FALSE,   lower_quantile = p10,   upper_quantile = p90,   shape = 16,   size = 2,   alpha = 0.5,   limits = NULL,   midpoint = NULL,   ylimits = NULL,   lump_n = NULL,   drop_l = NULL,   na_as_other = FALSE,   n_levels = NULL,   x_var = 0,   bg_x_var = 0.1,   bg_color = NULL,   seed = 123,   comparisons = NULL,   test = "wilcox.test",   paired_test = FALSE,   stat_compare_label = "p.signif",   stat_compare_label.y = NULL,   progressbar = TRUE,   save = FALSE,   filename = NULL,   width = 8,   height = 3.5 )

title: Plot drug distribution ‚Äî plot_distribution
text: con DBIConnection-class object DRP database .jitter_mask <data-masking> expression select samples/assays geom_jitter() .point_mask <data-masking> expression select samples/assays geom_point() .drug_mask <data-masking> expression select drugs x <tidy-select> Name factor use independent variable (x-axis) metric <tidy-select> Name DRP metric (continuous) use dependent variable (y-axis) color_fill <tidy-select> Name column used color fill readout_id Integer vector integers specifying id(s) readout point plot bg_readout_id Integer vector integers specifying id(s) readout jitter plot sort_by <tidy-select> Name column sort x-axis (e.g. norm_logAUC). Invert order dplyr::desc(<sort_by>). label <tidy-select> Name column used labeling drug curve selected_labels <data-masking> expression returning logical vector selecting labels displayed. Example: label = sid set instance selected_labels = sid %% c(1, 2) exclusively label two SIDs palette Character vector specifying color palette color fill (discrete continuous) color_fill_name Character string specifying alternative name color/fill legend add_boxplot Boolean specifying whether add boxplots add_line Boolean specifying whether add lines connecting geom_point quantiles Boolean indicating whether draw boxplot quantiles cohort_stats lower_quantile <tidy-select> Name lower percentile column cohort_stats table specifying min boxplot whisker. hide whiskers set lower_quantile = p25 upper_quantile <tidy-select> Name upper percentile column cohort_stats table specifying maximum boxplot whisker. hide whiskers set upper_quantile = p75 shape Integer specifying geom_point type size Integer specifying size jitter dots alpha Numeric specifying transparency jitter dots limits Numeric vector lower upper limits color/fill scale midpoint Numeric specifying midpoint colorscale ylimits Numeric vector lower upper limits y-axis lump_n Named vector integers specifying maximum number levels feature (including lumped "" category), e.g. c(diagnosis = 3) drop_l Named list character vectors specifying levels drop feature na_as_other Boolean indicating whether lump NA values "" category n_levels Integer indicating maximum number levels display x-axis x_var Numeric indicating amount random variation add points x-axis bg_x_var Numeric indicating amount random variation add background jitter points x-axis bg_color Character specifying uniform color background jitter points seed Integer specifying seed random number generator comparisons list length-2 vectors. entries vector either names two values x-axis two integers correspond index groups interest, compared. test Character string describing statistical test use comparisons. Allowed values include "wilcox.test" (Wilcoxon rank sum test) "t.test" (Student's t-test) paired_test Boolean indicating whether use paired test stat_compare_label Character string specifying label type. Allowed values include "p.signif" (shows significance levels) "p.format" (shows formatted p-value) stat_compare_label.y Numeric indicating y-axis position p-value label progressbar Boolean indicating whether show progressbar save Boolean indicating whether write plot disk filename Character string specifying filename width Numeric specifying width plot height Numeric specifying height plot

text: ggplot object

title: Plot drug response profiles ‚Äî plot_profile
text: con DBIConnection-class object DRP database .drug_mask <data-masking> expression returning logical vector selecting drugs displayed .fg_sample_mask <data-masking> expression returning logical vector selecting samples displayed foreground based columns plate_content_view .bg_cohort_mask <data-masking> expression select samples displayed background color_fill <tidy-select> Name column used color fill label <tidy-select> Name column used labeling drug curve size Numeric specifying line size readout_id Integer vector integers specifying id(s) readout foreground bg_readout_id Integer vector integers specifying id(s) readout background transform continuous scales name transformation object (e.g. "log10") object ("identity") palette character vector specifying color palette (discrete continuous) limits numeric vector lower upper limits color/fill scale midpoint Numeric specifying midpoint colorscale quantiles Boolean indicating whether draw percentile interval instead individual background curves lower_quantile <tidy-select> Name lower percentile column cohort_stats table upper_quantile <tidy-select> Name upper percentile column cohort_stats table sort_by <tidy-select> Name column used sorting facets n_drugs Integer specifying maximal number drugs drop_missing_drugs Boolean indicating whether drop drugs missing .fg_sample_mask lump_n Named vector integers specifying maximum number levels feature (including lumped "" category), e.g. c(diagnosis = 3) drop_l Named list character vectors specifying levels drop feature na_as_other Boolean indicating whether lump NA values "" category ylimits Numeric vector specifying y-axis limits xlimits Numeric vector specifying x-axis limits save Boolean indicating whether write plot disk filename Character string specifying filename color_fill_name Character string specifying alternative name color/fill legend bg_color Character specifying uniform color background fit lines show_na Boolean indicating whether translate NA values progressbar Boolean indicating whether show progressbar facet_samples Boolean indicating whether separate samples individual facets nrow Integer indicating number rows use facetting ncol Integer indicating number columns use facetting width Numeric specifying width plot height Numeric specifying height plot
